did.abstract: Collection primarily includes four sketchbooks by Allingham, but also contains four letters, a carte de visite, and two exhibit labels. The four sketchbooks date from 1868-1916, and feature sketches and drawings made in graphite, watercolor, and pen and ink. Subjects are varied, and include English cottages and buildings, architectural features, sailboats and coastal scenes, figures, landscapes, and botanical items. The letters, dated 1881-1882 and undated, include three written by Allingham. There is one to Marcus B. Huish regarding her painting, The Tea Party, which she reports is incomplete, but she plans to finish before it is exhibited. There is a letter to a friend to whom she sends autographs, then describes her country place and garden, along with her 4-month-old son. Another letter focuses on the difficulty of finding unfurnished rooms. The final letter in the collection is written by Andrew Halliday to Dr. Watkins, regarding Allingham's address. There is also a carte de visite of English women's rights activist Emily Faithfull, with her signature, along with two modern exhibit labels on Allingham.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Helen Paterson Allingham was an English watercolorist and illustrator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbook contains 95 watercolor drawings and a few pencil sketches, including images of sailboats, walls, cottages, landscapes, and figures. The inside front cover contains a list of locations. Some items have been removed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbook contains 49 watercolors, 184 pencil drawings, and 38 pen-and-ink drawings, all of botanical subjects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbook contains 186 pencil drawings and a few ink sketches of English buildings and architectural features.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbook contains 17 watercolor and 295 pencil sketches and drawings of English architecture and coastal scenes. Locations are usually recorded.
